newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon hails "daring" Chirac stand in Jerusalem.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon hails "daring" Chirac stand in Jerusalem.

text.p: Lebanon hailed French President Jacques Chirac on Wednesday for his "daring" stand during his visit to Israel.

"President Chirac's position was a daring one, and it expresses the openness of France and its feelings towards friendly peoples and towards the rights of the suppressed peoples all over the world," Foreign Minister Faris Bouez told reporters.
Bouez was replying to questions about Chirac's row with Israeli security during a tour of Arab East Jerusalem on Tuesday.

Chirac told Israelis that only a Palestinian state could provide Israel with the security it needs. He also objected to the heavy Israeli security which surrounded him on his politically charged visit to East Jerusalem.
The French leader is due to arrive in Beirut on Thursday on the fourth leg of his Middle East tour.
